page.title: 19TREMATON WATER SUPPLY
page.content: Trematon seems to have changed little in size for centuries.There are houses dating from medieval times and others rebuilt on earlier foundations.One of the restricting factors to growth was the supply of water.Trematon Hall,1800 had its water pumped from a stream by an{hydraulic ram}which also supplied a few neighbouring homes until the advent of piped water.The main source of water for the village was a well, still standing by the road.By the well is a notice -{"Privately owned well {used by the people of Trematon by {courtesy of the owner prior to the {supply of piped water in 1957".}Since then a few houses have been built including 15 bungalows in Townswell Close.However even with the{holding {tank at Winston Beacon}the water pressure is low,there will be no more building in the foreseeable future.
